name: Piazza Giacomo Matteotti (Greve in Chianti)
description: The main square in Greve in Chianti and a natural gathering point for coffee, a quick stroll, or a market stop. The arcaded layout makes it an easy pause before exploring nearby villages or wineries.
address: Piazza Giacomo Matteotti, 50022 Greve in Chianti
crowdNote: Most lively on market days and weekends.
hoursNote: Open-air square; check market schedules locally.

name: Badia a Passignano Abbey
description: A historic abbey tucked into the Chianti hills, known for its quiet cloisters and serene setting. It pairs well with nearby wineries and makes a peaceful counterpoint to bustling Florence days.
highlight: Quiet abbey in the Chianti hills
address: Strada di Badia, 29, 50028 Badia A Passignano
crowdNote: Usually calm, especially outside group tours.

booking.notes: Guided visits may require a reservation.

hoursNote: Check local site for visiting hours.

name: Osteria di Passignano
description: A refined Tuscan dining stop in the Chianti Classico zone, ideal for a long lunch or dinner between wineries. The menu leans on local ingredients and pairs easily with nearby estate wines.
highlight: Classic Chianti dining with wine pairings
address: Strada di Badia, 32, 50028 Badia A Passignano
crowdNote: Book ahead for prime dining hours.
